required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Debate on Progesterone Elevation on the Day of Triggering
clinical_study.official_title: The Neverending Debate on Progesterone Elevation: Possible Solutions

brief_summary.textblock:
The association between serum progesterone (P) levels, measured on the day of ovulation trigger, and the outcome of in vitro fertilization cycles, has been one of the major controversies in the field of ovarian stimulation endocrinology.
This is a single-center retrospective cohort study. Study duration period is from January 2012 to December 2016.
All fresh embryo transfer (ET) both at cleavage stage and blastocyst stage, performed in Humanitas Fertility Center during the study period, were included.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of PE on CPR and LBR
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the impact of premature high serum P levels on the outcome of fresh embryo transfer cycles in terms of Clinical Pregnancy Rates (CPR) and Live Birth Rates (LBR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Blastocyst embryo transfers' outcomes in PE
secondary_outcome.description: Furthermore, the present study retrospectively investigates whether the transfer of blastocysts on day 5 post-fertilization (D5-ET) may improve the CPR and the LBR in patients with P rise.

arm_group.description: embryo which is on day 2 or 3

intervention.description: Step of the assisted reproduction in which embryos are placed into the uterus in order to obtain a pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: All fresh embryo transfers both at cleavage stage (Day 2 and Day3) and blastocyst stage (Day 5), and all thawed embryo transfer, except from the ones deriving from PGTA, performed from January 2012 to December 2016 in Humanitas Fertility Center were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All fresh embryo transfers both at cleavage stage (Day 2 and Day3) and blastocyst stage (Day 5)
- Thawed embryo transfer deriving from supernumerary embryos cycles, by P increase, by OHSS, by other reasons (i.e inadequate endometrium, medical complications, etc)
Exclusion Criteria:
- thawed embryo transfers deriving from PGTA.
